identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Berberine in Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis
identificationModule.officialTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Berberine in Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis: a Multicentre, Randomised, Placebo-controlled Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of berberine treatment on Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This is a multicenter, double-blinded, randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial to investigate the efficacy and safety of berberine on subjects with Non-alcoholic Steatohepatitis.Patients with biopsy-proven non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) from 18-65 years of age were enrolled. Patients should had no excessive alcohol intake or use of any hepatoprotective or hepatotoxicity medication within 3 months before enrollment.Patients will have an screening period 12 weeks, and a 48-week double-blinded treatment period.
